data.title: Parks & Recreation
data.meta_description: The Parks and Recreation Department is responsible for creating and maintaining a system of parks and recreational facilities dedicated to providing quality services to improve the quality of life for the citizens of Odessa.
data.text:
Community Support - Odessa Parks Foundation

The Odessa Parks Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit that began in 2007 to aid the City Parks Department in improving city parks with playgrounds, statues, memorials, and outdoor movie showings, just to name a few. The foundation is funded by the Dollar Donation Program. There are always new and existing parks that are in need of help from the community. Please continue to "Opt-in" on your water bill and ask us how you can have a bigger impact on our city parks. Help us create and maintain our quality of life here in Odessa for generations to come.

For more information on how you can be a part of this program, visit the Odessa Parks Foundation website.

Sponsorship - Special Events

Our special events have an outstanding reputation for being top-quality experiences. Quality of life is most important and we strive to bring diverse recreational opportunities to our citizens, and make the City of Odessa the place to be for families to grow and build memories that will last a lifetime. Many events attract thousands of people from Odessa and many more from around the Permian Basin. Sponsors play an important role in these events by allowing us to maintain a high reputation at our events for little to no cost.

For more information or questions you may have, email Max Reyes or call 432-368-3548.

Floyd Gwin Park Renovation

Floyd Gwin Park is undergoing a major renovation that will add several features and amenities that the citizens of Odessa will enjoy for years to come! Floyd Gwin Park is a 45+ acre park that serves a large portion of West Odessa. A new baseball complex with 3 little league baseball fields will be built with concession stands. There will be a lighted walking trail added that comes to about 1 mile around. It will be fully lighted for safety and is also about 8 feet wide to accommodate people walking in both directions. Once the renovations are completed, Odessans will have a modern, state-of-the-art facility, to bring their friends and families to. Below are the amenities that are planned.

Drone Use Policy

Persons wishing to use drones on park property must adhere to the following guidelines:

You must be registered with the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and observe all regulations as administered by the FAA.

Pictures or videos of park property with the intent to advertise, market, or distribute must be approved by the City of Odessa Parks & Recreation Department.

You must email Max Reyes, and state the date you wish to fly, the purpose of the flight, which park you will be flying at, and what times the flight is scheduled to start and end.

You must not interfere with any individual engaged in the act of flying a kite. You must maintain a safe distance so as to not become entangled with the kite or line.

Metal Detector Policy

Metal detector use on park property is prohibited unless it is being used for the recovery of personal effects lying on the surface of the park.

Any digging on park property is strictly prohibited.

If you are using a metal detector for the purpose of recovering personal effects lying on the surface of the park, you must email Max Reyes.

How to Make a Reservation

In Person

Reservations can be purchased Monday through Friday during the hours of 8 am to 5 pm, at the Parks and Recreation office located at:

1100 W 42nd Street

Odessa, TX 79764

Online

Reservations can be made via our online reservation system. Follow the steps below to do so:

Reserve online here!!

Create an account or log in

Find the facility you want to rent on your specific date; follow the steps of the process and pay the Rental Fee

Read the contract; this will be emailed to you or you will be given a copy in person at our office - everything you need to know is outlined in the contract

Key and Damage Deposit is given only when you pick up a key (for community centers only)

Weekday rentals: pick up key the day of (Monday through Friday, 8 am to 5 pm)

Weekend rentals: pick up the key on Friday before 5 pm

Return the key, clean your building, and leave the building damage-free.
